Forrester Church performed the ceremony.

title: Gail Bidwell Marries S. Stinor Gimbel
description: Gail Sheppard Bidwell, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Wade Sheppard of Greenwich, Conn., was married there yesterday to S. Stinor Gimbel, a son of the late Lieut. Col. Louis S. Gimbel Jr. of the Army Air Corps and the late Mrs. Gimbel of New York and Wayside, N.J. The Rev. Richard Van Wely performed the ceremony at St. Barnabas Episcopal Church in Greenwich.

title: KENNEDY IS VICTOR IN THE METRO BOWL
description: Even though their coach said they had no incentive to win the Metro Bowl after taking the public school title, the John F. Kennedy Knights played like a team with a purpose yesterday and defeated St. John the Baptist, 30-26, in the seventh annual Metro Bowl football game.

title: What Reform? What Freeze?
description: Baseball fans don't predict the World Series on the basis of spring training, and it's no smarter to anticipate the outlook for the Federal Government next year on the basis of what the President and Congress said last week. There was plenty of talk about budget rigor and tax virtue, but it's more promises than promising.

title: AT LONG LAST, CLEVELAND'S SHIPS SEEM TO BE COMING IN
description: The Great Lakes were smokestack America's pathway to profits until manufacturers turned from shipping to speedier truck and train routes. But these days Cleveland's port is making a comeback that may signal economic change in a city that was hit hard by the recession and by foreign competition that devastated its steel industry.

title: Data Update
description: * Rates on most adjustable mortgages are set 1 to 3 percentage points above these indexes.

title: IMPACT OF BUDGET ON POOR ASSAILED
description: WHITE PLAINS WHILE the proposed 1985 county budget has drawn minimal political opposition, it has its critics and some of them turned out last week when two public hearings were held by a committee of the Board of Legislators.

title: Terrorists Are Outlaws
description: To the Editor:

title: MANAGEMENT SOFTWARE TO GET THE BOSS INVOLVED
description: LOS ANGELES

title: Chile Appliies 'A Heavy Hand'
description: As other Latin Americans turn to elected civilian rule, Chile's military regime appears increasingly isolated. Perhaps as a consequence, it has reacted in the past few weeks with increasing harshness to efforts by political, church and labor forces to oust President Augusto Pinochet and restore democracy.

title: PACE OF CO-OP CONVERSIONS SLACKENING
description: AT first glance, the 1984 co-op conversion

title: I.O.C. to Deny Soviet Charges LAUSANNE, Switzerland,
description: The International Olympic Committee's

title: DRIVERS MAY FACE ASSAULT CHARGES
description: For the first time in New Jersey, a state appeals court affirmed this week that a person who drives recklessly may be charged with aggravated assault if he injures someone in a motor-vehicle accident.

title: A Suspicion Unconfirmed
description: ''It is my evaluation - my analysis,'' a Time magazine correspondent testified last week when asked what seemed at least one of the $50 million questions in the libel suit filed by former Israeli Defense Minister Ariel Sharon.

title: COLLEGE HEAD MARKETING HIS SCHOOL
description: MAYS LANDING DURING his first week in Atlantic County, Ronald Bush toured all the gambling casinos in Atlantic City, visited a new company every day, met with local government leaders and talked at length to administrators of the community college here.

title: Sharon Teschemacher To Wed in May
description: Mr. and Mrs. Carl A. Teschemacher Jr. of Chatham Township, N.J., have announced the engagement of their daughter Sharon Rita Teschemacher to John Joseph Knightly, a son of Eleanor Cantine Knightly of Chatham Township and the late Dr. John J. Knightly. A May wedding is planned.

title:
ABOUT WESTCHESTER;
SUCH SWEET PLEASURE
description: BEDFORD HILLS

title: SERVED TWO TERMS IN SENATE FROM OHIO
description: Stephen M. Young, a former Democratic Senator from Ohio known for his pugnacious behavior, died of a blood disorder today at the Washington Home Hospice. He was 95 years old.

title: SOMEWHERE IN NEW YORK, YOU CAN BUY A GOOD BOOK
description: James Atlas is an associate editor of The Atlantic and the author of ''Delmore Schwartz: The Life of an American Poet.'' ONDON has Charing Cross Road, Paris has its quays, and New York used to have Fourth Avenue, but those days are gone. Except for the Strand and one or two unpromising secondhand shops, the bookstores that once lined both sides of the avenue have disappeared, leaving the city without a geographic center for bibliophiles. If it's diamonds you want, go to West 47th Street; antiques are on Hudson Street, flowers on Sixth Avenue in the 20's. But if you're looking for a copy of Ford Madox Ford's ''Great Trade Route'' or Frank Budgen's memoir of James Joyce, you can expect to spend the greater part of a day wandering up and down Manhattan.

title: MAILBAG
description: DEBATING THE STATE OF TV DEBATES

title: Crash Hurts Air Passenger
description: A Cascade Airways turboprop airplane carrying 13 passengers and two crewmen crashed on takeoff Thursday from the Pullman-Moscow Airport, slightly injuring one passenger, the authorities said.

title: BUOYANT ZIMBABWE BEATING DROUGHT
description: In the last year, the third year of southern Africa's worst recorded drought, Zimbabwe's peasant farmers - those who through the ages have produced little more than what they needed for themselves - brought to market more food and other crops than ever before.

title: PARENTS' PLEDGE: NO ALCOHOL
description: MORE than 200 parents have enrolled in Weston's Safe Homes program, pledging not to serve alcohol to youths under 20, the state's legal drinking age.

title: Allison Lee Becomes Bride Of Ford Worthy, an Editor
description: Calvary Episcopal Church was the setting in New York yesterday for the marriage of Allison Lee, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Henry H. Lee of Great Neck, L.I., to Ford Stedman Worthy, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Ford S. Worthy Jr. of Raleigh, N.C. The Rev. Thomas F. Pike officiated.

title: Martha Thorson Is Engaged
description: Mr. and Mrs. Abram Claude Jr. of Bedford, N.Y., have announced the engagement of Mrs. Claude's daughter Martha Ann Thorson to James Jay Gould, a son of Josephine Wilkinson-Gould of Bailey's Bay, Bermuda, and Boston and Edwin Jay Gould of Palm Beach, Fla., and New York. A June wedding is planned.

title: A HISTORY OF FIFTH
description: Fifth Avenue, known the world over for its luxurious shops and rich architectural detail, is the subject of an exhibition opening Wednesday at the Municipal Art Society's Urban Center, 457 Madison Avenue, at 51st Street. Called ''On the Avenue, Fifth Avenue,'' the display highlights the 10-block stretch from 48th to 58th Street.

title: AROUND THE GARDEN;
description: JOAN LEE FAUST This Week:

title: Tunisia
description: To the Editor:

title: MAIL-ORDER TREES GAINING IN POPULARITY
description: ''IAM very particular about my Christmas trees,'' said Teresa Baxter of Cherry Hill. ''I like a nice green tree that is fresh, full, six or seven feet tall and really scented - but not too much because of my husband's allergies.''

title: EFFECTIVE ADVANCE PLANNING
description: Many of the teams that came to Seattle a month ago for the World Team Olympiad had to overcome considerable financial problems. The combination of the strong dollar and national currency restrictions for tourists left some going hungry, eagerly waiting for the five excellent midnight buffets supplied by the local hosts.

title: O'ROURKE OUTLINES PROPOSALS FOR PLAYLAND
description: COUNTY EXECUTIVE Andrew P. O'Rourke unveiled a $13 million plan last week on the future of Playland, recommending that the 56-year-old Westchester-owned amusement park in Rye be divided into separate parts that would be parceled out to divisions of a restructured County Department of Parks, Recreation and Conservation.

title: ARMY BEATS NAVY, 28-11, FOR FIRST TIME SINCE '77
description: Army unleashed a merciless early attack on Navy and never let up today as the Cadets ended seven years of frustration with a 28-11 triumph in the 85th service-academy classic at Veterans Stadium.

title: Miss Rogovin to Wed Dr. Michael Jacobson
description: Mr. and Mrs. Mitchell Rogovin of Washington have announced the engagement of their daughter Wendy Meryl Rogovin to Dr. Michael William Jacobson, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Fred Jacobson of New York, Munich and Florence. The wedding is planned for March.

title: Murry Zborowski Wed To Dr. Annette Osher
description: Dr. Annette Osher, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Osher of Stamford, Conn., was married yesterday to Murry Zborowski, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Eli Zborowski of Forest Hills Gardens, Queens. Rabbi Feivel Wagner performed the ceremony at the Rye Town Hilton.

title: A VAST JEWELED RELIQUARY
description: Viscount Norwich, the author of ''A History of Venice,'' is the chairman of the Venice in Peril Fund in England. THE MOSAICS OF SAN MARCO IN VENICE

title: Data Bank; December 2, 1984
SUNDAY SPORTS Basketball
description: Nets vs. 76ers , at Philadelphia. Although the Nets lost to the 76ers, 118-96, at Byrne Meadowlands Arena this season in their first meeting, they have the best record against Philadelphia in the last three years, splitting the season series each year. (Radio - WNBC, 660, 8 P.M.) Football Jets vs. Giants , at Giants Stadium. The Jets were eliminated from the playoff picture last Monday night by the Miami Dolphins and can now play the role of spoiler. (Television - Channel 2, 1 P.M. Radio - WNEW, 1130, and WABC, 770, 1 P.M.)

title: Coast Flight of Shuttle Might Be Unclassified
description: Air Force officials are debating whether the first space shuttle flight from Vandenberg Air Force Base, Calif., should be unclassified.

title:
WESTCHESTER OPINION;
ANIMAL MAGNETISM OF THE WOODS ATTRACTS
description: HOLDING an acorn as large as its face in its mouth, a squirrel freezes in front of me, hoping I won't notice as I pass through the woods. A ray of sun has managed to penetrate the thick foliage and, like a spotlight, adds a dramatic glow to its black fur as it balances on hind legs. I am distracted by a bright orange chipmunk rustling in the fallen leaves. When I look back, the squirrel is effortlessly climbing four stories up into a maple tree.

title: Dickinson as Recluse
description: To the Editor:

title: LUXURY CONDOMINIUM FOR ATLANTIC CITY
description: ATLANTIC CITY THIS resort is known the world over for its glittering hotel- casinos, but it is also starting to attract a new kind of clientele: the affluent resident to whom the casino is just another seashore attraction and who is willing to pay top dollar to live in high style.

title: Transit Fares Are Safe, at Least for '85
description: No sooner had commuters gotten over their anger at the 90-cent subway and bus fare that went into effect last Jan. 1 than there was speculation it would soon go the way of the 75-cent token. But those fears were calmed last week when Governor Cuomo called for a two-year extension of a corporate tax surcharge that helps subsidize public transit in the metropolitan area. If the Legislature goes along with the proposal, fares on subways, buses and commuter railroads would not go up, at least until the end of 1985.

title: SURPLUS OF $800 MILLION IS FORECAST FOR JERSEY
description: The state will end the fiscal year with a surplus of $800 million, legislative budget aides estimate.

title: WHY AMERICA PAID ATTENTION TO THE FLUTIE THING
description: AT first glance, The Flutie Thing (a.k.a. The Legend, The Magic, The Mystique, The Continuing Saga of) looks easy: pleasant-faced, poised kid as the second coming of Frank Merriwell. With a dash of Albie Booth, a soup,con of Red Grange, a twist of Sid Luckman. A humanly scaled package that, week after week, dances up to the fire and comes away singed but victorious (even when B.C. loses,

title: ;  International
description: SUNDAY, DECEMBER 2, 1984 Mediation efforts in Chile are necessary to prevent the country from turning into ''another Nicaragua,'' Reagan Administration officials said. They said a monthlong review had produced an Administration consensus to seek mediation - perhaps by the Vatican, other Latin American countries, or even the United States - that could hasten a transition to democracy in Chile. (Page 1, Col. 2.)

title: SHARP GOALTENDING LIFTS RANGERS, 4-1
description: Even after it happened, it still did not seem possible that John Vanbiesbrouck, the Ranger goaltender, had actually caught the puck. On his side, hardly knowing from where the shot came, he snapped his glove out as if he wore the glove on a spring.

title: PUFFINS ARE MAKING COMEBACK ON ISLAND OFF SOUTHERN MAINE
description: A three- year attempt to re-establish the puffin, a northern sea bird with an outsize yellow, red and blue beak, on an island off the coast of Maine is showing signs of success.

title: BARNARD SAVORS ITS INDEPENDENCE
description: Georgia Dullea is a reporter for the Living/Style section of The Times.

title: PROPONENTS OF 'FREEZE' DIFFER ON INTERPRETATIONS
description: The idea of ''freezing'' the Federal budget, which gained wide currency here this week, seems to mean one thing at the White House and another on Capitol Hill.

title: JETS' O'BRIEN PROGRESSING
description: ''I WONDER,'' said Coach Bill Parcells of the Giants the other day,

title: PREPARIANG SNOW BLOWER FOR WINTER
description: HOMEOWNERS who do not take their snow throwers out of storage until the first time they actually see snow piled up in the driveway are taking a chance on being severely frustrated when they belatedly discover that the machine is not ready to do its work. The homeowner may find that the machine is very difficult (or even impossible) to get started, or it may be sadly in need of adjustments or repairs that will keep it from operating properly (or not at all).

title: Bourne Carries Heavy Load
description: When the Islanders began their trip through western Canada, it was apparent that something was tugging at Bob Bourne. Normally gregarious, the veteran forward sat quietly on the flight from New York last Tuesday.

description: M. H. REED

DOING WHAT'S BEST ISN'TALWAYS RIGHT

title: CAVEATS ON BUYING PROPERTY
description: BUYERS interested in shorefront homes often are so entranced by views and the pleasures of having a beach or dock at their doorsteps that they are willing to pay premium prices for such properties.

title: Justine Ruotolo Is Married To C. Christopher Gewehr
description: Justine Marie Ruotolo, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George C. Ruotolo of Dix Hills, L.I., was married yesterday to C. Christopher Gewehr, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Hamilton Gewehr of Bethesda, Md.

title:
GARDENING;
SPECIAL BOOKS FOR THE GARDENER
description: WITH the holiday season fast approaching, finding gifts for everyone on your list can become a bewildering task. However, if there are gardeners, you are in luck. Any serious gardener will appreciate a garden-related gift more than any other, and there are so many from which to choose.

title: NEW JERSEYANS
description: LOVE and enterprise have combined to make Louise Bonnicelli and her business a statewide affair.

title: Separatist Strife In Sri Lanka
description: Sri Lanka, a crowded island country off southeast India, has been periodically shaken by violence between the majority Sinhalese and extremists among the minority Tamils. Last week, the Government took unusual measures to ward off what it feared might be an invasion by Tamils from India in support of a campaign by fellow Tamils to set up a separate state in the northern part of the island.

title: PAPERBACK BEST SELLERS Dec. 2, 1984Fiction*1
description: CHANGES, by Danielle Steel. (Dell, $3.95.) The crises that arise when a television anchorwoman and a glamorous physician fall in love. *2 PET SEMATARY, by Stephen King. (NAL/Signet, $4.50.) The new family in town discovers the horrors that lie in a neighboring cemetery. *3

title: GovernmentBranchesAdopt Early-Retirement Incentives
description: A total of 44 local governments and government agencies have adopted regulations to implement early-retirement incentive programs since Sept. 1, State Comptroller Edward V. Regan said today.

title: What We Really Know About Russia
description: The most significant conclusion to be drawn from Leslie H. Gelb's article, ''What We Really Know About Russia'' (Oct. 28), may be an inescapable realization that spying is becoming decriminalized. Through legitimate contacts, as well as spy satellites and electronic surveillance, both sides possess the growing capability to probe deeply into each other's secrets - without penalty.

title: CHAIM GROSS: 60 YEARS OF CARVING WOOD
description: MICHELANGELO'S description of the carver as someone who releases the image he can see imprisoned in the block of stone or wood also seems well suited to the 20th-century sculptor Chaim Gross.

title:
GARDENING;
SPECIAL BOOKS FOR THE GARDENER
description: WITH the holiday season fast approaching, finding gifts for everyone on your list can become a bewildering task. However, if there are gardeners, you are in luck. Any serious gardener will appreciate a garden-related gift more than any other, and there are so many from which to choose.

title: POLICE SET TO BALK TERRORIST ATTACK
description: A middle-aged police officer sits in a patrol car for hours, whistling softly and watching the blowing leaves.

title: Adirondacks
description: To the Editor:

title: Losses More Than $9 Million In Blockage of St. Lawrence
description: Nine days after the failure of a vertical lift bridge blocked the St. Lawrence Seaway channel, 138 ships remained unable to move beyond Montreal today.

title: PROSPECTS
description: Those Lagging Rates

title: DOWN THE YANGTZE
description: Christopher S. Wren is The New York Times Peking bureau chief. By Christopher S. Wren ANY WORTHY undertaking in China starts with a meeting, and a voyage aboard the East Is Red No. 46 was no exception. Once the river steamer had pulled away from the dock at Chongqing in the early morning drizzle and swung into the cocoa-colored waters of the Yangtze, the ship's loudspeaker asked passengers in each cluster of cabins to dispatch a representative to the small dining room on the second deck.

title: MUSEUM IN JERSEY CELEBRATES LIFE OF THE AMERICAN WORKER
description: Pietro Botto's home was a rallying point for the American labor movement in its early years. But when Mr. Botto, an Italian immigrant and silk weaver, died in 1945, his obituary in a local newspaper noted only that he had the finest flower and vegetable garden in the valley.

title: Church Bans Sermons By Fiery Polish Priest
description: Jozef Cardinal Glemp, the leader of the Roman Catholic Church in Poland, today banned a priest from preaching in Warsaw churches, ruling that his anti- Communist sermons were ''alien to the spirit of the Gospel.''

title: DRAMA STUDENT IS STABBED TO DEATH ON WEST SIDE
description: A 23-year-old Harvard graduate who came to New York City this fall to study acting was forced at knifepoint to the roof of her Upper West Side apartment building early yesterday and stabbed to death when she resisted being raped, the police said.

title: Cardinals Roll Over Patriots by 33-10
description: The Cardinals won a game today that kept them in contention for the playoffs, while the result came close to eliminating the losers, the New England Patriots.

title: EXECUTIVES SPLIT ON TAX PLAN
description: Although the profound changes in tax policy proposed by the Treasury last week would eliminate major breaks for business, no single wave of opposition has yet to emerge from the corporate world.

title: THE KILLING OF A STUDENT ATHLETE: A STORY OF 3 CHICAGO FAMILIES
description: On a cold, bright fall afternoon, Ben Wilson, one of the nation's premier high school basketball players, was walking with two girls on his lunch break when he came upon several boys blocking the sidewalk. Minutes later he lay dying.

title: Union Leader Sees Hope for City Pact
description: The president of the city's largest public-employee union said yesterday that he was ''optimistic'' that he would be able to reach agreement with the city on a new contract by Christmas.

title: NEW LTV STEEL CHIEF FACES ARDUOUS TASKS
description: For the second time in two years, Davvid H. Hoag, the new chief executive of the LTV Steel Company, has unexpectedly moved up to the No. 1 spot at a company. And for the second time in a row, the 45-year-old Pittsburgh native takes the helm when his company is mired in hard times.

title: Death of 670-Pound Inmate Ends in Prison Disturbance
description: Dozens of prison inmates staged a six-hour disturbance early today after guards refused to remove the body of a 670- pound inmate who had died of an apparent heart attack, a prison spokesman said. No injuries were reported.

title: G.O.P. LEADERS CALL FOR SLOWING MILITARY GROWTH
description: The Senate's new Republican leaders gave their first estimates today of how much they think President Reagan should slow the growth of military spending to help reduce Federal budget deficits.

title: Bridge:ATransferAuctionProvides Interesting
description: To savor the interesting and difficult problem faced by West on the diagramed deal, the reader should cover the East and South hands and plan the defense. The contract is six hearts reached after a transfer auction in which South has shown two aces. The spade king is led and wins the first trick.

title: Raiders Down Dolphins ;  Marino Sets N.F.L. Mark
description: It wouldn't say much for the defending champions if the next Super Bowl tournament began and they weren't in it.

title: Philippine Army Reports Killing 23 Rebels
description: Army troops killed 23 Communist rebels while 10 soldiers died in a battle with about 200 insurgents northeast of this southern Philippine city, the military reported today.

title: David Saul Gary Is Wed To Barbara Nan Carabell
description: At the Jericho (L.I.) Jewish Center yesterday Barbara Nan Carabell, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Carabell of Syosset, L.I., and Fort Lauderdale, Fla., was married to David Saul Gary, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Howard J. Gary of Huntington, L.I., by Rabbi Martin Steinhardt.

title: Baby Born at Disneyland
description: Juan Manuel Granados came down from Disneyland's Space Mountain ride Saturday to learn that his wife had given birth to a daughter in the park's first-aid station.

title: BRIEFS ;  Debt Offerings
description: * American Brands Inc. is issuing $100 million of 11 percent three-year Eurobonds at par with debt warrants, through underwriters led by Morgan Stanley International.

title: Vice Chairman's Post Created by Con Edison
description: The Consolidated Edison Company of New York said it had elected John V. Thornton to the new position of vice chairman.

title: REBEL TRAINING BOOK LINKED TO CASEY VISIT TO HONDURAS
description: Senior officials of the Central Intelligence Agency, including its director, William J. Casey, decided at a June 1983 meeting in Honduras to provide Nicaraguan rebels with training in psychological warfare, a step that led to the writing of a manual that caused a furor in Congress, according to Government officials here.

title: Girardelli Takes Opening Slalom
description: Marc Girardelli, the Austrian-born skier who competes for Luxembourg, won the opening slalom event of the men's World Cup by a wide margin today.

title: AUSTRALIA ELECTION CALLED 'SIGNIFICANT CHANGE'
description: In his hotel suite this morning, the opposition leader, Andrew Peacock, offered his views on the meaning of the Australian elections held Saturday.

title: DANCE: ALVIN AILEY SOLO FEATURES DUDLEY WILLIAMS
description: The dancers of the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater seem to get younger and move with an increasingly elegant line and attack with every year. But the phenomenon isn't entirely new. Dudley Williams, who is celebrating his 20th anniversary with the company this year, is proof of that. But Mr. Williams isn't one of the great dancers of our time by virtue of his technique and style alone. He dances with an intensity that makes everything he does quietly, distinctively dramatic. A case in point is ''Love Songs,'' which Mr. Williams performed on Saturday night at City Center.

title: A PRIEST OFFERING HIS FIRST MASS FEELS BLESSED BY HIS VOCATION
description: The day of John Michael Paddack's first celebration of mass was a gift of cold winter sunshine. The Lord, said Father Paddack, had blessed this day with His strong hand and with His gentle hand - the bite of winter and the warmth of the sun.

title: 5 Women Held in Protest Of Clergyman's Jailing
description: The wives of five pastors were arrested today on the steps of a Lutheran church while protesting the jailing of the Rev. D. Douglas Roth, who had used his pulpit to support union activists in the Monongahela-Ohio valley.

title: MONDAY SPORTS Football
description: Chargers vs. Chicago Bears , at San Diego. The Bears are riding high after routing Minnesota, 34-3, eight days ago to clinch the National Conference's Central Division title.

title: CORRECTION
description: A review of the New York City Ballet on Saturday missidentified the leading dancer in the scond section of ''Western Symphony.'' He was David McNaughton.

title: GOALIE'S THIN SKIN HEALS A BIT
description: Things had been said to him, small things really, words that should have bounced off his chest the way pucks did on Saturday night. But by playing poorly, every pore had been opened and John Vanbiesbrouck stung from the subtle criticism.

title: David Thomas, Jamie Bernstein Exchange Vows
description: Jamie Ann Maria Bernstein, a daughter of Leonard Bernstein of New York and Fairfield, Conn., and the late Felicia Montealegre Bernstein, was married yesterday to David Thomas, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Herman O. Thomas of Hudson, Ohio. Rabbi Lawrence Siegel performed the ceremony at the New York home of the bride's father.

title: RECESSION IS CALLED UNLIKELY
description: Despite languid production and declines in the index of leading economic indicators, few economists are expecting a recession soon.

title:
FUTURES/OPTIONS;
PESSIMISTIC SOYBEAN OUTLOOK
description: SOYBEANS, one of the nation's most important crops, have been drifting steadily lower in price in terms of futures trading, as the harvest, now more than 90 percent complete, has progressed.

title: CHARITIES SAY GIVING WOULD SHRINK
description: Organizations that depend on charitable contributions would be severely hurt if the Treasury Department's plan for revising the income tax system were adopted, according to spokesmen for religious groups, universities, foundations, cultural institutions and associations providing services to the needy. They said contributions from individuals, which totaled $53.8 billion last year, could be cut as much as 20 percent.

title: WHY WE SHOULD SUPPORT WORLD COURT
description: To the Editor:

title: A REFUGE FOR WADING BIRDS ON STATEN I.
description: The herons, egrets and ibises of New York City will be surprised. For the last 20 years or so, hundreds of the birds have nested on two islands and dined at a nearby pond amid a battery of smokestacks, oil tanks and industrial piping on the Arthur Kill.

title: Hasbro Bradley Hires Ex-President of Mattel
description: Hasbro Bradley Inc., the toy manufacturer in Pawtucket, R.I., has announced that Raymond P. Wagner, former president of Mattel Toys, has been named to the new position of vice chairman.

title: 'Messiah Sing-In' Dec. 19 at Fisher Hall
description: Amateur singers can add their voices to those of professionals at the National Choral Council's 17th ''Messiah Sing-In'' on Dec. 19 at 7:30 P.M. at Avery Fisher Hall, Broadway at 67th Street.

title: ARGENTINA IN ACCORD ON DEBTS
description: Leading international banks and the United States Government agreed last night to provide Argentina with more than $18 billion in credits to help the Latin American country restructure its foreign debts.

title: A GOLDFADN HIT OF 1880 IS REBORN OFF BROADWAY
description: Avrom Goldfadn's ''Kuni-Leml'' was one of the big hits of the 1880 theater season in Kharkov, Russia. That the show is an Off Broadway success this season, more than a century later, is largely attributable to Nahma Sandrow.

title: 3 FIELD GOALS LIFT CHIEFS PAST BRONCOS
description: Nick Lowery kicked three fourth- quarter field goals today, including one of 42 yards with 1 minute 56 seconds to go, helping Kansas City to a 16-13 victory over the Denver Broncos. His counterpart, Rich Karlis of Denver experienced a nightmarish replay of his last-second kicking failure of last week.

title: DISPUTE SNARLS PROJECT FOR DEMOCRACY ABROAD
description: Are they boondoggles for junketing politicians and possibly a device for meddling in the affairs of foreign countries?

title: GOING OUT GUIDE;
description: ANOTHER VIEW To connoisseurs of photography, Lewis Hine is famous for his pictures of immigrants and workers in America in the first half of the 20th Century. Now, an exhibition of 50 photographs he made for the Red Cross war relief in Europe at the end of World War I, is on public view, many of the prints for the first time in open exhibition, at the Baruch College Gallery, 135 East 22nd Street.

title: Unleaded Gas Trading Set
description: The New York Mercantile Exchange has scheduled trading in unleaded gasoline futures to begin today, joining contracts in heating oil, crude oil and leaded gasoline.

title: EVIDENCE OF COACHING
