title: A GROUP AIDS THOSE WHO LOSE A SPOUSE
description: DOMINICK LAMBERTI, 72 years old, and Vera Carriero, 60, organized last night's annual dinner dance for fellow members of the Stamford and Norwalk chapters of Widows-Widowers Associated , but now may no longer be members themselves. The couple recently married.

title: NORDIQUES BEAT DEVILS
description: Anton Stastny scored two goals and added two assists, and Peter Stastny collected a goal and three assists tonight to lead the Quebec Nordiques to a 7-3 victory over the Devils.

title: Headliners ; In Her Own TimeThe bows that
description: Leontyne Price takes after singing ''A"ida'' at the Metropolitan Opera Jan. 3 will be her last as an operatic performer. But Miss Price, one of the world's leading sopranos for the last quarter-century, made it clear last week that giving up opera performances doesn't mean giving up singing.

title: WILANDER RETAINS AUSTRALIAN TITLE
description: Mats Wilander beat a determined Kevin Curren today in the men's final of the Australian Open Tennis Championships at Kooyong.

title: TEACHERS' RAISES: TIMING IS DEBATED
description: THE billboard on the highway exit ramp leading to the State Capitol states in bold letters, ''Now is the time to raise teachers' salaries.''

title: PIANO: ALISON DEANE
description: When it comes to credentials, from biographical credits to on-stage charm to unadorned pianism, Alison Deane would seem to have nearly everything she needs for a major career. Occasionally, at her otherwise most appealing recital Thursday night at Alice Tully Hall, one wished for just a little

title: U.S. Envoy in Saudi Arabia
description: King Fahd of Saudi Arabia held talks today with the Assistant Secretary of State for Near East Affairs, Richard W. Murphy, the official Saudi Press Agency reported. It gave no details of the talks.

title: THE REGION ; Boss Tweed'sLandmark
description: The Tweed Courthouse may not hark back to the finest days in New York City's past, but it is history nonetheless, the Board of Estimate decided last week. With the board's approval, the 19th-century monument to the underside of the Age of Enterprise was officially promoted to landmark status.

title: TENETS OF CREED
description: According to the Paterson Police Department, some of the tenets of the Five Percent Nation of Islam, as collected from writings and from its members, are as follows:

title: ;  International
description: SUNDAY, DECEMBER 9, 1984 39 more hostages were freed by the Arab hijackers holding a Kuwaiti plane at the Teheran airport, but they retained two American and three Kuwaiti officials after vowing to ''keep the guilty ones on the plane,'' according to diplomats and the Iranian press agency. The hijackers reportedly threatened to put the Americans aboard the plane on trial. Those freed appeared to be mostly Pakistanis. (Page 1, Column 6.)

title: Dr. Robin Altschuler Weds Dr. Lowell Taubman
description: Dr. Robin Jane Altschuler, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Matthew Altschuler of Kew Gardens Hills, Queens, was married yesterday to Dr. Lowell Berne Taubman, a son of Dr. and Mrs. Herbert Taubman of Hewlett Harbor, L.I. Rabbi Lowell Kronick performed the ceremony at the Middle Bay Country Club in Oceanside, L.I.

title: Salzburg
description: To the Editor:

title: SPANISH MASTERS AT REOPENED MONCLAIR
description: MONTCLAIR AT 2 P.M. today, the Montclair Art Museum will officially be back in business, and the prince who aroused the beauty, asleep since last May, is the Cintas Foundation.

title: Commercializing Yachts Protested
description: In the last decade, commercialism has crept into the sport of yachting, mostly through the back doors of post- regatta parties and non-sanctioned races.

title: SENATOR PLANNING SWEEPING HEARING ON FOREIGN POLICY
description: The next chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee plans to begin a sweeping public review of American foreign policy next month to seek a broader bipartisan consensus on where the nation stands internationally.

title: Mark Tremallo, Wellner Poppe Engaged to Wed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Charles Walker Poppe of Huntington, L.I., Durham, N.C., and Acapulco, Mexico, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Wellner Anne Poppe, to Mark Van Bael Tremallo, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Frederick Gene Tremallo of Exeter, N.H. A summer wedding is planned.

title: LETTERS TO THE NEW JERSEY EDITOR
description: Parents' Criticism Called Misdirected In response to an article on Nov. 18 about education of the disabled, I would like to say that I feel the Teaneck parent advocacy group directed its anger and hostilities toward the wrong person and office.

title: BURGEONING RARITAN CENTER
description: A new development phase at Raritan Center that will add more than 1 million square feet of office, industrial and research space to the sprawling commercial park in Edison, N.J., will begin with the construction of a two-building office complex off Woodbridge Road near Exit 10 of the New Jersey Turnpike.

title: Help for Susquehanna Shad
description: Three utilities whose hydroelectric dams on the Susquehanna River prevent shad from migrating agreed Friday to spend $3.7 million to increase the fish population.

title: FINDING AGENTS WITH SPECIAL EXPERTISE
description: If you ask travel agents how to find

title: SHOREHAM DRILL: WHAT IT ENTAILS
description: WHEN the New York Power Authority, New York State and the four counties around Indian Point recently held a drill to test their preparedness for an accidental release of radiation at Indian Point 3, they had lots of company. Along with the Federal officials grading the test were representatives of another entity with an abiding interest in emergency planning: the Long Island Lighting Company.

title: PAPERBACK BEST SELLERS
description: Dec. 9, 1984Fiction*1(Dell, $3.95.) The crises that arise when a television anchorwoman and a glamorous physician fall in love. *2 PET SEMATARY, by Stephen King. (NAL/Signet, $4.50.) The new family in town discovers the horrors that lie in a neighboring cemetery. *3

title: MONROE DOCTRINE:THERE, BUT NOT DOCTRINAIRE
description: To the Editor:

title: THE WORLD ; Food for Africa'sFamine Pipeline
description: The United States and Western Europe pledged nearly two million tons of food for Africa last week, but relief workers at the other end of the pipeline feared that for thousands of hungry children, it may arrive too late. In Ethiopia, where 6.4 million people are ''in serious distress,'' Unicef officials said three-quarters of the 300,000 people who have died since March were younger than 4 years old. In Korem, a center for 40,000 famine refugees, the daily death rate dropped from 50 to 30 a day, but at Bati, a camp for 25,000, more than 120 people were said to be dying daily. Ethiopian authorities said 1.2 million tons of food will be needed during the next 12 months.

title: IVY LEAGUER VISITS THE 'REAL WORLD'
description: WHEN Joe Paterno told the Ivy League a few years ago to join the ''real world'' of college athletics, I, along with so many other Ivy Leaguers, was incensed. Not only had we been abandoned by one of our own - wasn't Paterno a former Ivy Leaguer, a quarterback at Brown in the 1950's? - but we felt he had put us down. After all, we were the ones who began the autumnal madness known as college football more than a century ago.

title: LETTERS TO THE WESTCHESTER EDITOR Day Care Requires Some Care Itself
description: Tessa Melvin's article, ''Day-Care Options Explored'' (Nov. 4) effectively outlined some of the steps private corporations are taking to ensure that their employees have access to day-care facilities. These are very positive and encouraging signs and as a parent of a son who spends about 45 hours a week in a center that might be the best in Westchester, the Eastchester Child Development Center, I applaud these efforts.

title: PROPOSALS FOR MENTALLY DISABLED EASE ELIGIBILITY FOR U.S. BENEFITS
description: The Administration has drafted new rules for the Social Security disability program that would liberalize the criteria for awarding benefits to people with severe mental disabilities.

title: TV WORK STIRRING VOLUNTEERS
description: THE cameraman's finger hits the wrong button, and the picture turns bright purple. The eloquent speakers at a Board of Education meeting are drowned out because the taping equipment is unwittingly stationed under a ventilating fan. The anchor suffers a lapse of memory and looks about in panic.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''I think it is fair to say that I share the basic assumptions of the President and Secretary of State in regard to foreign policy.'' - Senator Richard G. Lugar, Republican of Indiana and next chairman of the Foreign Relations Committee. (20:5.)

title: A CHRISTMAS APPEAL: HELP THE NEEDIEST CASES
description: A bleak Bronx apartment building, its walls covered with graffiti, is providing Miriam with stability - something she has known little of in her 27 years. Miriam, whose real name is not used here, was born in Puerto Rico, where she dropped out of school at 17 and married at 19. By the time she was 25, she had four children and an alcoholic husband who beat them regularly.

title: CHURCH, CAPITALISM AND DEMOCRACY
description: FREEDOM WITH JUSTICE

title: Dana Susan McBride Plans to Marry John F. Lacey, a Bank Vice President
description: Mr. and Mrs. Robert Dana McBride of Sewickley, Pa., have announced the engagement of their daughter Dana Susan McBride to John Fairbank Lacey, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Norman F. Lacey of Mendham, N.J., and Alexandria, Va. The wedding is planned for May 4.

title:
LONG ISLAND OPINION;
RAKING LEAVES, THINKING OF RAIN
description: ONE recent Sunday, I raked leaves for most of the day. I raked and piled and pushed them into large green store-bought plastic bags, complaining about the need to do it at all.

title:
ABOUT WESTCHESTER;
ROAD TO ADVENTURE
description: IN some ways, it seems like a

title: CONABLE TO TEACH AFTER RETIREMENT
description: The University of Rochester has announced that Representative Barber B. Conable Jr., Republican of New York, who is retiring from Congress, will become a Distinguished University Professor next year.

title: CONDOMINIUM OFFICES GETTING MIDTOWN TEST
description: A NEW office building named Delmonico

title: CHINA CALLS RIGID ADHERENCE TO MARXISM 'STUPID'
description: China says rigid adherence to Marxist theories cannot be depended upon to solve the nation's problems.

title: Sarah M. Billock Marries in Darien
description: The marriage of Sarah Massengale Billock, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Edward Massengale of Darien, Conn., to David Gregg 3d, a son of Mrs. James Verry Macgregor of Darien and the late David Gregg, took place yesterday at the home of the bride's parents. The Rev. Douglas Ray performed the Episcopal ceremony.

title: NO MORE CONCESSIONS!
description: David Owen was the British Foreign Secretary from 1977 to 1979. He is now the leader of the British Social Democratic Party. HOW DEMOCRACIES PERISH

title: Federal Law Post Filled
description: Attorney General William French Smith has appointed Prof. Charles Fried of Harvard Law School to be Deputy Solicitor General and counselor to the Solicitor General.

title: 6 COLLEGE PRESIDENTS FORESEE STRONG ROLE FOR LIBERAL ARTS
description: Liberal arts curriculums can be a ''formula for success'' in America despite a trend in higher education toward job-oriented courses, a panel of six college presidents said.

title: STAGE: 'GIFTS OF THE MAGE,' O. HENRY SET TO MUSIC
description: Like an overloaded Christmas tree, ''The Gifts of the Magi,'' a musical adaptation of two stories by O. Henry, is a show so laden with tinselly sentiments and candy cane platitudes that it should appeal only to those with a hearty appetite for holiday sweetness and light.

title: PAKISTANI CHIEF STARTS CAMPAIGN TOUR FOR REFERENDUM
description: President Mohammad Zia ul-Haq, seeking the widest possible endorsement in a referendum later this month, set out today on a 10-day campaign tour that will take him all over the country.

title: Vietnamese Say China Fired 52,000 Rounds Over Border
description: The Hanoi radio accused China today of stepping up border provocations by firing more than 52,000 rounds of mortar and artillery into Vietnam last month.

title: 'CABBAGE' DOLLS STILL HARD TO FIND
description: SOME customers in Boyd's, a Newtown toy store, break down and cry. Others plead with the store's manager, Stacey Duerr. ''I've even been offered a bribe,'' she said.

title: Alan Twaits Engaged To Donna A. Francis
description: Announcement has been made by Anna M. Francis of Rutland, Vt., formerly of Washington, of the engagement of her daughter Donna Ann Francis to Alan Richard Twaits, a son of Helen B. Peace of Middletown, N.J., and Vero Beach, Fla., and the late Elmer A. Twaits. An April wedding is planned.

title:
NEW JERSEY OPINION;
AN UNCERTAIN FUTURE FOR THE STATE'S INNOVATIVE HOSPITAL-FEE SYSTEM
description: FIVE years ago, New Jersey began a controversial hospital payment system that eventually would become the most influential experiment in hospital payment in the country.

title: Fugitive Killed in Fire After Fight With F.B.I.
description: Law-enforcement agents and a fugitive holed up in a remote house traded gunfire tonight in a battle climaxed by a huge fireball that destroyed the home and killed the suspect, officials said.

title: DANCE: RESHOTKO GROUP AT FOLK ARTS CENTER
description: Several works that Deborah Reshotko and Company presented Monday night at the Ethnic Folk Arts Center collapsed dramatically before they were done. The reason why these dances were top-heavy was that Miss Reshotko's choreography tended to be prop-heavy.

title: Rachel Buchsbaum Plans To Wed Michael H. Arwe
description: Dr. and Mrs. Solomon J. Buchsbaum of Westfield, N.J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Rachel Joy Buchsbaum, to Michael Henry Arwe, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Kenneth J. Arwe of Keene, N.H. An April wedding is planned.

title: EXPLORING AN ISLAND NATION
description: Indonesia Getting There Indonesia is about 17,000 miles, an international dateline and 12 hours away from New York. Eight international airlines link Halim, Jakarta's main airport, and the United States. Since the flight from New York takes about 22 hours, not including connections, a layover is recommended.

title:
SPEAKING PERSONALLY;
HOW TO GET RICH AND ARROGANT: STEP 1
description: AFEW months ago, I finally broke down and entered the world of investments. I guess it was inevitable; everyone I knew was into stocks, bonds or precious metals.

title: Groza Files Suit
description: Lou Groza, the former Cleveland Brown placekicker, and his wife have filed a damage suit contending that they were defamed on an ABC situation comedy last season.

title: PRICES HIGH AND LOW
description: Herbert Kaufman was until recently a senior fellow at the Brookings Institution. His books include ''Red Tape: Its Origins, Uses, and Abuses'' and the forthcoming, ''Time, Chance, and Organizations: Natural Selection in a Perilous Environment.'' THE IDEA OF ECONOMIC COMPLEXITY

title: AALBORG IS THE TOAST OF AQUAVIT DRINKERS
description: Say ''aquavit'' - or, if you're the monosyllabic type, ''schnapps'' - to a Danish bartender and you'll trigger a small, riveting ritual. A cone-shaped frosted glass about the size of a large thimble will be plucked from the freezer. A similarly chilled bottle of aquavit will be presented for inspection, then poured, the thick liquid rising to the rim of the glass, stopping just above it.

title: SHULTZ SCORES A BACKSTAGE VICTORY
description: To people who were not paying close attention, the announcement last week by Larry Speakes, the White House spokesman, may have seemed a bit odd. He quoted President Reagan as saying that, ''at the recommendation of the Secretary of State, I have today asked Ambassador Paul Nitze to serve as adviser to the Secretary for the Geneva talks.''

title: A PRECOCIOUS PLAY CONTIUES TO LEAD A FULL LIFE
description: Christopher Hampton is 38 now, no longer the boy wonder who had a play produced in London's West End while still a student at Oxford, no longer the young graduate who made a bit of British theatrical history as the first so- called ''resident dramatist'' at the Royal Court Theater. But the promise and talent of a precocious youth have survived his maturity.

title: Virginia Neary Engaged
description: Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. James Francis Neary of Merrick, L.I., of the engagement of their daughter Virginia Rose Neary to Michael Joseph Echter, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Conrad Echter of Latham, N.Y. A February wedding is planned.

title: AROUND THE WORLD ; 15 Injured in Bangladesh In Student-Police Clash
description: At least 15 people were injured today when the police clashed with students during a nationwide anti-Government strike that has paralyzed Bangladesh, the police said.

title: MAILBAG
description: To the Editor:

title: A LETHAL CLOUD FALLS ON AN INDIAN CITY
description: IT came on the evening wind that drifted

title: No Headline
description: On late afternoons in Salt Lake City at this time of year, just as the last rays of the fading sun are painting the snow-streaked face of the Wasatch Mountains with a soft wintry glow, the Christmas lights come on in Temple Square.

title: G.A.O. IS CRITICAL OF UNESCO POLICIES
description: The policies and management of Unesco should be changed in many major areas, according to a report by the United States General Accounting Office.

title: PORNOGRAPHY DEALER PLEADS GUILTY TO SHIPPING LEWD TAPES
description: A man who the authorities say is a major distributor of pornographic films, books and magazines has pleaded guilty in Federal court here to transporting hundreds of obscene videotapes across state lines for distribution in Canada.

title: BUSINESSES ARE PART OF SCHOOL SPIRIT AT PRINCETON
description: When it comes to buying anything from pizza to personal computer software, or renting anything from televisions to tuxedos, students at Princeton University do not have to leave campus.

title: Dimitri Dimancescu Is Dead; Prewar Rumanian Diplomat HARTFORD, Dec. 8 (AP) - Dimitri Dimancescu, a former Rumanian diplomat, died here Thursday. He was 88 years old.
description: A graduate of the University of Bucharest, he received the British Military Cross for sabotaging Rumanian oil wells during World War I to hamper the German war effort.

title: CONCERT: RUSSELL SHERMAN, PIANIST
description: Russell Sherman, a pianist who dropped out of the concert mainstream with his career barely begun in the 1950's and re-entered it some 20 years later, returned to Carnegie Hall in a program of masterpieces Monday evening. His playing of Beethoven's 28th and 30th Sonatas and Liszt's Sonata in B minor, complemented by short works of the same two composers, held the listeners' interest as unflaggingly as the pianist's own probing interest was engaged with the music.

title: WHITE MEN DISCOVER IT'S A SHRINKING MARKET
description: Fred Grubb had worked for 15 years at a Jones & Laughlin steel plant in Pittsburgh until he was laid off in June 1982. Mr. Grubb, who is married and the father of two girls, says he does not know what will happen to him now.

title: SANTA, IN GESTURES, DELIVERS THE MESSAGE OF CHRISTMAS
description: ELIZABETH RIGNEY is 7 years old and unlike many children her age, she had never been to see Santa Claus. Elizabeth, a Guilford resident, is hearing impaired, and has never heard that question familiar to so many children: ''And what do you want Santa to bring you for Chistmas?''

title: Winter Nuptials For Miss Tabell
description: Mr. and Mrs. Anthony Weber Tabell of Princeton, N.J., have announced the engagement of their daughter Roberta Jane Tabell to Robert McCook Jordan Jr., a son of Mr. and Mrs. Jordan of Scarsdale, N.Y. The wedding is planned for February.

title: 49ers Roll Over Vikings, 51-7
description: Joe Montana, playing only the first half, completed 15 of 21 passes for 3 touchdowns as San Francisco 49ers ran up their highest point total in 19 years in routing the Minnesota Vikings today, 51-7.

title: Montana Manhunt
description: Three days after 23-year-old Kari A. Swenson, a member of the United States Olympic biathlon team, was kidnapped while jogging near Big Sky, Mont., two searchers found her on July 20 chained to a tree in the surrounding mountains.

title: U.A.W. TO CONSIDER CANADA AUTONOMY
description: The leadership of the United Automobile Workers is scheduled to meet here starting Monday to consider a demand from its Canadian wing for almost complete autonomy.

title: CONSULTANTS SAY THEY CANNOT EVALUATE TAX-ABATEMENT PLAN
description: A consulting firm that was paid $100,000 by the city to find out whether the housing tax-incentive program is worth the money it costs in tax breaks has determined that it cannot answer the question.

title: EXPERTS DOUBTFUL ABOUT OUTLOOK FOR THE POOR
description: Experts from the academic world and the Government have concluded after a two-and-a-half-day conference that there is nothing in view that would propel the estimated 35.3 million poor Americans out of poverty.

title: ARMY RE-CAMOUFLAGING ORDER: PAINT EVERYTHING
description: The Army has begun to paint tens of thousands of pieces of field equipment - everything from cruise missiles to electrical generators - with a new camouflage pattern.

title:
ANTIQUES;
DECORATED TINWARE PRIZED BY COLLECTORS
description: FROM about 1750 to 1850, a loosely knit band of Hartford County craftsmen - called bang-alls by their neighbors - created and carried on a major industry eventually so great that scarcely an American household was without at least one treasured example of their work.

title: RANGERS FALL TO FLYERS BY 4-2
description: The losing goes on for the Rangers. And the winning continues for the Flyers, who beat the Rangers tonight at the Spectrum by 4-2.
